title: Grids and Modules for Pictograms and Characters.
content:
I'm looking for visual examples of grids and modules for Logos, Icons, Pictograms and Typefaces.   
   
My list contains:   
   
- Wim Crouwel: Alphabets   
- Norm: The Things. Norm: SimpleKoelnBonn ( [www.lineto.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013171313/http:/www.lineto.com/) \> The Designers \> Norm \> Simple-Airport \> Specimen \> Page 2)   
- [http://briem.ismennt.is/2/2.3.4a/2.3.4.02.grid.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013171313/http:/briem.ismennt.is/2/2.3.4a/2.3.4.02.grid.htm)   
   
Do you know more?   
   
   
(Wasn't there a picture of the transit font's bell with grid somewhere?)
author: Thorsten Geiger

comments.content:
I like _Visual Function: An Introduction to Information Design,_ by Paul Mijksenaar. It is a tiny book, but good. I think it has some schematic ISO pictograms in it.
